title: Adult Neuronal Ceroid Lipofuscinosis: Epidemiological Overview
short_description: A clinical document detailing the prevalence and incidence rates of adult neuronal ceroid lipofuscinoses, an extremely rare neurological disorder.
long_description: This document provides epidemiological data on adult neuronal ceroid lipofuscinoses (ANCL), a group of extremely rare neurodegenerative disorders. The document presents prevalence estimates of approximately 1.5 per 9 million people in the general population and discusses varying incidence rates ranging from 1.5-7 per 100,000 live births across different countries. The content includes clear definitions distinguishing between prevalence (total existing cases at a given time) and incidence (new cases born per year), providing essential statistical context for understanding the rarity and distribution of these genetic disorders.
